Stillingfleet, The Bishop of Worcester's Charge to the Clergy of His Diocese, Works, HI, 631. The Latitudinarians were divided on occasional conformity, the practice by which Dissenters could circumvent the Test Acts by 'occasional' reception of Holy Communion according to the Anglican rite. Stillingfleet, for example, could not understand how a man's conscience could permit him to conform occasionally and dissent regularly, and Fowler registered objections to it in 1707 in his Charge to the Bishop of Gloucester
note: But Tenison approved. See Carpenter, Thomas Tenison,
